definition: from the inside to the outside/through and through/thoroughly

from/through/via/to follow/to obey/to engage in (an activity)/never (in negative sentence)/(Taiwan pr. [zong4]) retainer/assistant/auxiliary/subordinate/related by common paternal grandfather or earlier ancestor

li, ancient measure of length, approx. 500 m/neighborhood/ancient administrative unit of 25 families/(Tw) borough, administrative unit between the township 鎮|镇[zhen4] and neighborhood 鄰|邻[lin2] levels
to (a place)/until (a time)/up to/to go/to arrive/(verb complement denoting completion or result of an action)

sentences.english: Whole person from the inside out has changed.
sentences.chinese: 整个人从里到外都改变了。

sentences.english: Of course, you think you know your products inside and out, right?
sentences.chinese: 当然，你认为你已经从里到外的掌握了该产品，对吗？

sentences.english: She's just a beautiful person inside and out.
sentences.chinese: 她是一个从里到外都非常美丽和善良的人。

sentences.english: I know her inside and out.
Like tea, a hot soup can warm you from the inside out.
sentences.chinese: 和茶一样，热汤也能让你从里到外暖洋洋。

sentences.english: Momentum was helping to shape a new me, inside and out.
sentences.chinese: 动力正在帮助我从里到外塑造一个新的自我。

sentences.english: Every woman wants to know her man inside and out.
sentences.chinese: 每一个女人都想要从里到外彻底地了解那个他。

sentences.english: The house is made of wood from inside to the outside.
sentences.chinese: 住宅从里到外都由木头建成。

sentences.english: Most of these improvements came in the form of upgrades to surface and side materials, which would clearly distinguish authentic shoes from knockoffs.
sentences.chinese: 这些改进可以从里到外的使正品大大区别于仿冒品。

sentences.english: Kevin discovered that every one of his T-shirts had been turned inside out.
sentences.chinese: 凯文也发现他的一件T恤衫从里到外翻了个个儿。

sentences.english: The police searched the car inside and out, but found no drugs.
sentences.chinese: 警察将那辆车从里到外搜了个遍，但是没有找到毒品。

sentences.english: Apply blush on risorius. Gently smear it obliquely from inside to outside for several times.
sentences.chinese: 把腮红刷在笑肌处，从里到外轻轻地斜刷几次。

sentences.english: Total care, inside out, from young to old.
sentences.chinese: 从里到外，从小到老无微不至的关怀。

sentences.english: This plan basically turns the data structure inside-out.
sentences.chinese: 这个计划基本上将数据结构从里到外翻了个个儿。

definition: to look completely new (idiom); brand new/changed beyond recognition
beneath the surface/fundamentally/at the deepest level
untainted by even a speck of dust (idiom); selfless and incorruptible/spotless
to shed one's mortal body and exchange one's bones (idiom); born again Daoist/to turn over a new leaf/fig. to change wholly/to create from other material (story, artwork etc)
external appearance and inner thoughts coincide (idiom); to say what one means/to think and act as one
